intro: Pedicularis campylosiphon, commonly known as the zigzag lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and semi-parasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color. It grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is often found in high-altitude meadows and is a subject of interest in botanical studies.
